message.content:
cs.PL, cs.CR, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a novel type system for verifying constant-resource behavior in programs, which suggests that it belongs to the programming languages (cs.PL) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses information flow tracking and noninterference, which are topics commonly studied in the computer security (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also mentions the potential method, which is a technique used in the analysis of algorithms and complexity theory, indicating that it may also belong to the logic in computer science (cs.LO) sub-category. The paper discusses the automation of the type inference algorithm, which suggests that it may also belong to the software engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of the type system in verifying encryption and decryption routines, database queries, and other resource-aware functionality, indicating that it may also belong to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category.
